Subject: ANN: New SharpNEAT release (with single pole balancing)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=127853030
X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod

There is a new release on the (slightly reorganized) SharpNEAT web site 
http://www.cgreen.dsl.pipex.com/

A single-pole-balancing domain is available along with a pole balancing 
simulation tool. There is a perfect pole balancing network in the 
'networks' dir, but don't take my word fot it, try evolving one for 
yourself :)

The prey capture domain is still being worked on, the fitness function 
currently employed punishes for the number of timesteps taken to catch 
the prey. Right now though the punishment needs re-adjusting (it's too 
harsh) so you probably won't see very good results without modification. 
Again, the current best network is in the 'networks' dir.

In the main tool new search parameters are provided: 'Species droppoff 
age' and 'Interspecies mating proportion'.

Colin.
